content.label: You couldn't be bothered to support screen rotation?   I have an iPad Pro with keyboard and I am forced to choose between forgetting this game and moving on, or holding my ipad upside down.   I just checked my wife's 4th gen iPad and it's the same thing - you can't use a standard Apple stand and watch/play this game.  Seriously?   And I see this was last updated in mid-2015 so I am expecting nothing will be done.   Shame on me for not reading the reviews first where this was called out.

Okay, we need some more of these games. This was literally brilliant. I'm a computer/PS4 gamer, and generally play AAA Titles from large Dev Teams, and I think I had more fun with this game than any of those games recently. Whoever thought of this is a genius, and you better bring more, or I'll find you! Lol.

I rarely write reviews, but I loved this game so much. It was so open ended that I haven't stopped thinking about it in days. I loved the challenge of finding new clips and the haunting plot. I would love to see more games like this, or perhaps a sequel.
But for this I had to! This is my favorite game I have ever played. Please make more like this, it is very short. Thank you, xoxo

This game has a really good story, a lot of twists and turns and is simply amazing but is not worth $5 and here's why: I just beat the game in an hour or less. Why spend 5 dollars on something that lasts 30 minutes? The story is amazing and I would suggest it to a friend but I would just let them use my phone so they wouldn't waste their money. This game isn't as good as Device 6 (I compare these games together because they are both good story driven games) because Device 6 took days to complete and was $4 - worth the money.
If you can blow $5 do it - it's a good short story - if you want a game worth your money - go to year walk or device 6.

Really interesting story. The whole experience was like pulling the layers off an onion to discover the details. I also liked that the player could draw their own conclusions about what really happened.

Hard to put down and very refreshing to have a game that is actually interested in exploring a fascinating story of friendship/sisterhood/betrayal in a way that is led by the ideas and conceptions of women themselves rather than driven by men...Even though the dead body is that of a man, he is only a data point that allows one to dig deeper into the relationship of two women.

title.label: It will leave you wanting more!

content.label: Intriguing mystery game! You will not be disappointed with this one!

So after reading reviews and a price drop I had to try it. I was a little confused at first there are no instructions but I caught n quickly remembering what I had read in the reviews. I have another game that I play everyday and have done so for a year....haven't played that game since I picked this one up. I can't seem to put this down . I have figured a lot out rather  quickly. It shocked me I guess I hit the right keyword. Threw me off guard though I wasn't prepared for it lol. Great game however I already know I won't get the complete story with this one....I'll have to wait for pt 2 I'm sure...and I want to know ðŸ¤”...her story
Excellent, brief story that keeps your head turning. Very enjoyable.

title.label: I didn't know games could be this good

content.label: Within minutes I was entranced by the story. It's intensely emotional and it unfolds in a really innovative way.

title.label: Good game, slightly frustrating on an iPad

content.label:
This was a great game.  I couldn't put it down! I did get frustrated b/c I was playing on my iPad and it made me hold it upside the whole time.  I couldn't use the keyboard stand, and I either had to type upside down or constantly flip the device.  That said, it didn't STOP me from playing, so don't let that stop you either.  Just be aware before you buy that you can't use your device as you normally do.

The game and mystery itself was a lot of fun though.  If you like straightforward games with clear directions you will NOT like this game.  If you like getting pieces of a mystery in no particular order and figuring things out then you will LOVE it!

title.label: unusual and fun to figure out

content.label: This game is truly unusual and a real treat - easy to understand, clever internal logic, intuitive controls, and striking artwork. Requires a bit of logic and a bit of strategy (and occasionally, quick reflexes) but not too hard or too easy. If I could give it six stars, I would.
Have a note book to keep notes. It took time and patience, but it was great.
This is a great game, Though Please add support for rotation during landscape when using a Keyboard on the iPad Pro.  Due to the smart connector, the game is upside down when docked!

This is sold as the next wave of gaming, but it's user-interface and design is underdeveloped for a $5 app.  The only real mystery here is trying to figure out what the developer was thinking to be able to end the game, not so much what the storyline is as you would get in a real mystery novel. Be prepared to be thrown into a story told in five second video clips, and not getting all the pieces needed to even figure out what happened.

This is a great game. The price doesn't bother me--I choose to look at it like I rented a movie for the night, since I did finish it in a matter of an hour or two.  I liked seeing the story in bits and pieces. It wasn't overly confusing, and it did add a slightly creepy air at certain points.

However, once the chat screen popped up (perhaps because I'm on a phone?), the video interface moved to the side to expose another clickable (the purpose of which I'm not exactly sure), cutting off my access to the fifth video in a search. So I'm pretty sure that I'm not able to see everything there is to see. 

I do still have quite a few questions, and maybe that's a feature of the game, but I think it's more likely that I just can't access all the videos due to telling the little chat guy that I'd figured it out. So don't end it until you are sure you've seen everything.

All in all, creative and engaging, but four stars for not being able to go back and re-watch everything.
If you want a great mystery detective game, then this is the one for you. It has an awesome story and will keep you hooked all the way to the end. Worth the price for sure.

No frills here. Very boring. You would have to be a sucker like me to believe any of the positive reviews and spend $5 on this terrible app. The layout is more than confusing. There is little if any fun here. Guess I'll have to give up my next Starbucks.

Lot of effort put in, and definitely a creative triumph.  A must buy if you love wallowing in sorrow, but all you millennial lolcats out there likely won't understand the historical context.  A few very very short clips were extraneous and I gave up trying for the very last clips.

DO NOT buy this game if you use an iPhone. I am using an iPhone 6s with all software up to date according to Apple. My phone is running iOS 9.2.1 so I dont know what app designers are talking about when they mention Mac OSX  10.8. That's for the desktop NOT for the iPhone!

I expect a refund because these people dont mention any of these issues up front. I discovered them right after trying to use the app. Shame on Apple for letting this one get by them! 

God I really miss Steve Jobs!
The rotation feature does not work.  I have a case that only works one way being that it has a keyboard attached.  It would be nice if I could rotate the game to the position I need.

Though I am a lover of most interactive games, and did enjoy this game for the 25minutes it took me to solve the mystery; I am not a "gamer" or "techie" by any means. I am, however, highly disappointed in the end result. There is not "grand hurrah". Once you figure it out thats it. Its over. No work involved. No submitting your guess to the solution, no "Colonel Mustard with a candlestick in the bathroom" gratification of any sort. You just assume you're correct. Definitely not worth $5.
Had some really horrible details that I wouldnâ€™t repeat, and poor performances. Getting a refund for this. I realize that it is kind of a clever game but really didnâ€™t draw me in.

When I started it, it had videos to watch. I watched them. Nothing happened. I looked at the please read, and didn't get any info. Am I missing something? It doesn't tell you anything. To confusing. 0/10

I've been waiting for mobile games to branch out into more media-focused interactive tales.  This is like watching a great crime drama but, unlike TV, you actually have to think a bit :)
I loved it and would recommend it to anyone in games or who likes a good mystery.

All I asked for was the option for the game to be compatible with flipping screen sides.

Nope.

Can't be bothered. If you're left-handed and that's your preference; tough cookies.

For all the praise that this game has received for it's supposed originality, it's lamentable that the developer is so busy gloating that he won't listen to simple requests from customers that have paid him their money for his game.

So good to see an original game for a change. It would be great to see Chromecast/Apple TV integration. Being able to use the phone as a keyboard/input and watch the TV as a monitor would be outstanding.
I have this for my PC and I love it there and I just got this version and it's still the same and I love the style of mint. I understand why it was #2 indie game of 2015

I thought it would be better than it was. It also seemed very short and I felt it cost wayyyy more than it should. 
I really wish I hadn't bought it and hadn't listened to the reviews that seemed to think that this was a great game. It seemed boring to me. 
I might have been okay if it was maybe $0.99 but at $4.99 it's a bit of a ripoff and I love these kind of games....Just my opinion.

Never mind whether this is really a "game" in the strictest sense. I was absolutely taken in. I was visiting someone while I was in the middle of it, and I had to get on their wifi to keep trying to get those last bits. Amazing concept.

title.label: I like it but one thing

content.label: In the game there is this reflection of a face on the "computer screen" of the game and the deeper u get into the game the more the face shows and idk why but it scares the crap outta me. Plz get rid of the face lol
Playing on iPad pro with the smart keyboard, and the game only plays upside down.  Makes no sense that the game can only be played in one orientation.

Don't get from fooled by all media hype, this "game" is the reason why FMV games failed in the first place. The only interaction you will see here is typing words and checking how many videos you have left until you have "enjoyed" the whole movie.

If you are ever tempted, do yourself a favor and go watch a short film,because that is all you are going to get from here. The only thing that was neat was the screen filter, but that's it.
I can't rotate the app ,it always takes the right side down , which is the worst side

I made a note quite a while back to download this game when I could and I finally did just yesterday. The game itself is rather short but the experience, the uniqueness, it was worth it. Genuinely, and unsurprisingly, I've never played a game quite like this. I kept getting further and further into the rabbit hole and it was exhilarating! I wanted to know more and keep going. I felt like I was really putting together a puzzle, and it was incredibly satisfying.

+++ for the music, mood, story

Enjoyed trying to unravel the mystery, and even untangle my own goals in the whole thing.  It's not perfect (especially the mechanic for ending), but immersive and gripping, and likely to appeal to those who don't normally play video games.  Fun framing device of an old computer console gives pangs of nostalgia to some...

A very unique and captivating game unlike any other I've ever played on a mobile platform.  I actually ended up playing through the entire story in one sitting.  The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the replay value is relatively low once you play though it once and figure out the story.
This was the first game of this type that I have played. It was a fun challenge! It was all the fun of watching a good procedural plus the challenge of discovery.

My bf and I played this over the weekend, we took turn taking notes and searching the app. 

 Keep in mind that this is not your conventional game.  In a way I'd say this was the best movie I've ever played. It is  morbid, well written, nicely executed, and leaves you asking questions. I can't stop thinking about it. 

I'd love to see more games in this format!

title.label: Save your money & watch for free.

content.label: It's a cool experience but I definitely wouldn't consider it a game. All you're doing is watching interrogation videos and searching for keywords in a database. There's nothing to "solve" as there's no real outcome to it. You're better off just watching the videos on YouTube for free. And they're in order so it's much less confusing!

Not through the game yet, but it's just a wonderful piece of work. From the music to the UI to the mystery being pieced together to the acting, it's fantastically done. Please people, buy this game and support great work like this.

Update: Glad to see this team got on a lot of best games of the year lists. Congrats!

The title says it all. I don't write reviews (this is my first ever), and I am compelled to share that in spite of the "innovation" or "edge" this "game" may tempt you with, it ultimately does little more than intrigue the user until interest is lost. The acting is subpar, at best. Of course with Leo Dicap winning a GG for his miscast performance in the travesty that is "The Revenant", I am not sure most people will even see how blatantly thespian (and thus bland, since we ain't watching a play) her acting is... It's moot though, cause if this were $.99 then I'd say, buy it, but at the price it's been at, trust me, you may as well find some fulfillment figuring out some answer or getting some concrete sign of progress in an equally interesting game that does not purport to be unique and not feel shafted out of the small fortune which is the cost of Her Story. Honestly, it gets old REAL FAST.

title.label: Pretty creepy but lots of fun to figure out

content.label: Hours of play to solve it. Videos play where you have to piece the puzzle together. Best game I've bought and played so far. Worth the money
Amazing game. I loved it and I always play it in school. It's not really a game, you're basically just watching clips and each clip gets interesting and interesting.

This is a truly unique mystery game that will leave you wondering what the truth really is. I'm dying to know for certain myself. If you enjoy watching real life murder mysteries on TV, and trying to solve them...you will enjoy this game. But beware, the game does not tell you if you are right or wrong. I've read that the developer created this game with only one correct answer in mind, and I'm glad because I don't like it being left open for interpretation. I want to know the truth!

I found it to be a very interesting artistic choice to show the entire game upside-down!

Seriously, fix the orientation. It is very annoying.  Home button on the right side is the standard orientation for iPad stands, but this game plays the other way.

This game pulls you into a strange story full of plot twists. It's unfortunate that there are not more ways to mark up or view the clips in succession, but the story is rich and evocative. 

I just wish that solving the mystery provided some payoff --> a diagram or master video or some kind of resolution.

I've yet to solve the mystery or mysteries behind the game, but the design is already inherently intriguing and the more you search for answers, the more questions arise.

The only thing I ask of the iPhone/iPad version is orientation awareness; with the standard iPad Smart Cover the screen is upside-down! The game itself is fantastic; this one minor design flaw does not take away from the game experience itself. Very happy with the purchase.

I love mystery games but this one is weird. You don't really have to watch the videos. You just search and search and search. I would probably give it a better rating if it was 99Â¢. But in my case it was really dumb.
